comment.author: 22227133@N00
comment._content: Milatzo probably was Milazzo a sicilian name

comment.author: 48535929@N08
comment._content: John was my 3rd cousin and yes the name Milatzo was Milazzo it was changed for some unknown reason.

comment.author: 34916975@N08
comment._content:
The Milazzo family is from Sicily. The family has an official crest.
The father of John the pilot who died, lived in Wyoming and had a shoe shop there. He was well known public figure there, and was known for assisting other Sicilians in his status as Italian representative there.

comment.author: 52184884@N07
comment._content:
John was my great-uncle - I would love to get in contact with Qrp cw ! As you are my cousin too!
There is a Milatzo Ave. in Cheyenne to ths day, either named after my famous uncle who trained with Lindburgh, or my great-grandfather who also gained local fame as Italian Consulate to Cheyenne.
